intro: Houlletia odoratissima var. antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian houlletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ornamental and ecological studies.
